meanings.definition: Deliberately avoid using or abstain from.
meanings.sent1: She eschewed sugary drinks to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: He always eschewed shortcuts and preferred the long route.
meanings.sent3: The cat eschewed the new brand of food, turning up its nose at it.
meanings.sent4: The detective eschewed the obvious suspect, looking for a more cunning criminal.
meanings.sent5: The student eschewed distractions to focus on studying for the exam.

meanings.sent1: The eschewed path through the forest was overgrown and eerie.
meanings.sent2: The eschewed topic at the dinner table made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The eschewed house on the hill was rumored to be haunted.
meanings.sent4: The eschewed book in the library seemed to hold a mysterious secret.
meanings.sent5: The eschewed painting in the gallery had a strange, unsettling aura.
